#### gitops-starstreak.net

> Flux management of my home server

## üëã Overview

This repo contains my flux2 based gitops workflow for maintaining my Ubuntu based [k3s](https://k3s.io/) cluster. Storage for stateful containers comprises local pv using OpenEBS [zfs-localpv](https://github.com/openebs/zfs-localpv) and nfs for accessing data stored on my NAS.

[Renovate](https://renovatebot.com) is used to automatically open pull requests for updated helm charts and github sourced release manifests.

The following applications should be available on the system being used to install and manage the cluster:

- [kubectl](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/tools/install-kubectl-linux/)
- [flux](https://fluxcd.io/docs/installation/)
- [gpg](https://gnupg.org/)
- [sops](https://github.com/mozilla/sops)

## üíª Hardware

Right now the system comprises 3 identical Lenovo Thinkcentres - M720Q's with Intel Core i5-9500T, 16GB DDR4 and 256GB WD 730 NVME SSD's.

## ü•æ Bootstrap the cluster

Create the flux-system namespace:

```
kubectl create namespace flux-system
```

Export the SOPS secret key from GPG and import to the cluster:

```
gpg --export-secret-keys --armor "4CF588582D481BB5C1927F275BB27F59F87ABCA3" | kubectl create secret generic sops-gpg --namespace=flux-system --from-file=sops.asc=/dev/stdin
```

If this is a new installation or no pre-existing github token is available run:

```
flux create source git flux-system --url=https://github.com/Drae/gitops-starstreak.net --branch=main -n flux-system
```

Now apply the flux manifests using kustomize:

```
kubectl apply -k cluster/base/flux-system
```

This will need to be run twice due to race conditions.
